The IFS reviews each game that a player is reported in, regardless of how many people report them. Additional reports do not add any kind of weight to it or make the system review it any harder. Basically 1 report is equal to 9 reports in a given game. Therefore, all you are doing by telling people to report someone is using the system as a way to threaten other people, which is toxic behavior.

I can't really say if what you did was worth a punishment seeing as I don't have your chat logs, however the current system works in tiers.

10 game chat restriction
25 game chat restriction
14 day suspension
permanent suspension

So if you have already passed the first tier then any toxicity would move you to the next one. That being said, I would suggest not doing anything relatively toxic as your next punishment will be a two week suspension.
